title: 'Black box' telematics insurance mistakes push up car insurance premiums
text:
Drivers who use “telematics” devices to get cheaper insurance could be shocked to see their premiums rise instead as evidence emerges that the black boxes can be inaccurate and unfairly penalise customers.

This newspaper has seen cases where insurers have told customers they were driving badly when their cars were standing still, or speeding when they were under the limit.

One accused a motorist of driving over the English Channel to France when his car was stationary on a ferry.
